posts.name: doruk bazan
posts.cooked: Hello, I’m Doruk from the 8557 mechanical department. We decided to do a small off-season project with my friend Batu from the electronics department. Our project: To convert the MK4 module we have to MK4i modules with parts we printed from a 3D printer. The most important reason for doing this is the problems we experienced at customs. Note: We will not compete with 3D parts. This is just a project to be done for fun.

posts.name: Calvin Selin
posts.cooked: I’m interested in how this progresses!

posts.name: doruk bazan
posts.cooked:
GOOD NEWS !

Here is the photo of the finished printing of our parts, we will get the bearings from our local supplier to finish the assembly of the module, so we will have a few days of mandatory break semi mk4i project 1876×2048 335 KB

semi mk4i project 1876×2048 335 KB

semi mk4i project 1876×2048 335 KB

posts.name: doruk bazan
posts.cooked:
Hello everyone again, after a long break (unfortunately, there were some technical problems with our 3D printers) we have finished assembling our module. Our module is working as planned, but there is another small project we plan to try.

To reduce the gear ratio of our module and switch to a new module design that will increase its speed by 2-3 feet per second. For this purpose, our first priority is to design a module that is designed according to the materials we have and European standards. Our main purpose in doing this is to facilitate the production of our module. Stay tuned for developments.

posts.name: doruk bazan
posts.cooked:
Gragas 1206×969 133 KB

Gragas 1206×969 133 KB

Gragas 1206×969 133 KB

Here is our module: “Gragas”

dorukbzn:

switch to a new module design that will increase its speed by 2-3 feet per second

Really cool but Looking at the pic it has neo 1.1 motors if that is what you plan on running on a competition weight robot trying to go faster than L3+(19ft/sec) ,which is the highest speed offered by SDS , the acceleration is going to suffer. Top speed is great if you have enough room to get up to speed but with shorter sprints acceleration with traction would be quicker

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: My views are mine and mine alone

posts.custom_user_title: My views are mine and mine alone

posts.name: Göktürk Aytaç
posts.cooked: Are those wheels original or custom-made ?

posts.name: doruk bazan
posts.cooked: Thank you for your feedback, as we mentioned in our first post, this is just a small off-season project. Of course, we plan to have the module produced in metal, but the speed in the module we will produce in metal will be closer to the sds data because the losses we make from torque will also reduce the traction power of the robot, and we do not want to make a robot that is less durable and difficult to move in the field, so we plan to produce metal modules without changing the current torque level. Modules with modified torque are made only with 3D printing for both education and entertainment purposes for our rookie members.

suggested_topics.title: Swerve X covers
suggested_topics.excerpt: Does anyone have models for Swerve X covers? We want one for Swerve X Flipped, not X2. My team can design our own but I’d prefer just to get them off here to save some time.

suggested_topics.title: New Control System for 2027?
suggested_topics.excerpt: I heard that LabVIEW will be discontinued for FRC, is there any more news about actuators, peripherals and sensors? Thanks with all for the feedbacks!
